content:
• Thursday, October 6, 2011

  • Natural gas LP Regency Energy (RGP) drops 4.7% AH after announcing it's commencing a public...

    Natural gas LP Regency Energy (RGP) drops 4.7% AH after announcing it's commencing a public offering of 10M units, and granting underwriters the option to purchase an additional 1.5M units. Regency plans to use the proceeds of the offering to repay borrowings from an existing credit facility.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:29 PM
  • ILMN

    Illumina (NASDAQ:ILMN) falls 21.1% AH after the company announces preliminary Q3 revenue of...

    Illumina (NASDAQ:ILMN) falls 21.1% AH after the company announces preliminary Q3 revenue of ~$235M, below a consensus of $277.7M. Illumina blames the shortfall in part on delayed purchases as a result of uncertainty about research funding, and lower-than-expected sales of its HiSeq systems - possibilities Leerink Swann warned about last month. (earlier)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:23 PM | 1 Comment
  • RBN

    Industrial equipment maker Robbins & Myers (RBN +7.2%) shot higher today after reporting FQ4...

    Industrial equipment maker Robbins & Myers (RBN +7.2%) shot higher today after reporting FQ4 revenue of $259M (+85% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.77, beating consensus by $4.1M and $0.02. The company also announced its board had authorized a new 3M share buyback plan.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:52 PM
  • IPGP

    IPG Photonics (NASDAQ:IPGP) gains 5.2% AH after receiving a favorable judgment in a patent...

    IPG Photonics (NASDAQ:IPGP) gains 5.2% AH after receiving a favorable judgment in a patent infringement lawsuit filed against it by rival industrial laser vendor IMRA.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:40 PM
  • CSII

    Cardiovascular Systems (NASDAQ:CSII) guides its FQ1 lower, now seeing revenue at $18.7M. The...

    Cardiovascular Systems (NASDAQ:CSII) guides its FQ1 lower, now seeing revenue at $18.7M. The company says a shift in peripheral arterial disease procedures to physician-based labs caused hospital-based procedures and related purchases to decrease. Shares -7.9% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:19 PM
  • SREV

    ServiceSource (NASDAQ:SREV), a provider of technology solutions for increasing services revenue,...

    ServiceSource (NASDAQ:SREV), a provider of technology solutions for increasing services revenue, jumps 12.7% AH after announcing preliminary Q3 revenue of $49M, above a $46.2M consensus. The company also expects adjusted EBITDA for the quarter to exceed $2.5M, above prior guidance of $500K-$1M. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:16 PM
  • HIG

    Hartford Financial (HIG +4.2%) finishes the day higher after saying that a "stress scenario"...

    Hartford Financial (HIG +4.2%) finishes the day higher after saying that a "stress scenario" that includes a 30% stock-market decline, a weaker U.S. dollar and a steep drop in interest rates would leave the company with a capital margin of $1.3B.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:08 PM
  • OCR

    Omnicom Group (NYSE:OCR) +7.8% after saying an early review of the CMS's proposed change that...

    Omnicom Group (NYSE:OCR) +7.8% after saying an early review of the CMS's proposed change that would require nursing-home pharmacists to be independent won't have "any material adverse effects" on its business. Still, OCR opposes the change, claiming it could lead to residents being denied consulant services and/or higher costs.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:06 PM
  • SPLS

    Staples (SPLS +3.1%) tacks on a gain after Deutsche reiterates its Buy rating on shares. Rivals...

    Staples (SPLS +3.1%) tacks on a gain after Deutsche reiterates its Buy rating on shares. Rivals OMX +1.5% and ODP +7.3% also move higher, despite being placed "on review" this week by Morningstar.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:50 PM
  • ERT

    eResearch Technology (ERT +4.6%) jumps after Citigroup upgraded the stock to buy from hold...

    eResearch Technology (ERT +4.6%) jumps after Citigroup upgraded the stock to buy from hold earlier today on valuation, saying the downward momentum in its business trend has bottomed.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:49 PM
  • WWW

    Wolverine World Wide (WWW +4.5%) trades near its highs for the day after being upgraded to buy...

    Wolverine World Wide (WWW +4.5%) trades near its highs for the day after being upgraded to buy at Argus on the back of its strong Q3 earnings report earlier this week and a solid FY11 outlook.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:37 PM
  • PLL-OLD

    Pall (PLL-OLD +3.2%) approves a $250M share repurchasement program on top of the $200M remaining...

    Pall (PLL-OLD +3.2%) approves a $250M share repurchasement program on top of the $200M remaining from a previous plan.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:35 PM
  • HAL

    Citi believes long-term oil service fundamentals remain sound, and stays bullish on the...

    Citi believes long-term oil service fundamentals remain sound, and stays bullish on the industry. Although stocks could slip if oil prices continue to slide, "drilling necessitated by production declines [would] continue to support the long-term outlook." Top oilfield companies rally, extending a weeklong advance: HAL +5.2%, NOV +5.8%.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:33 PM
  • ALK

    Alaska Airlines (ALK +3.5%) is trading higher today after reaching a tentative agreement with...

    Alaska Airlines (ALK +3.5%) is trading higher today after reaching a tentative agreement with its mechanics union on a proposed five-year contract for the carrier's 626 aircraft technicians and related employees.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:28 PM
  • WBMD

    WebMD (WBMD +10%) jumps after Barclays, which started the health information provider at...

    WebMD (WBMD +10%) jumps after Barclays, which started the health information provider at Underweight last month, upgrades the company to Equal Weight, believing market expectations have come down enough. WebMD fell 7% yesterday after announcing it expects Q3 revenue at the low end of its prior guidance range.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:25 PM
  • P

    Pandora (P +6.8%) gets a bump higher after the company says Toyota (TM +0.6%) will offer an...

    Pandora (P +6.8%) gets a bump higher after the company says Toyota (TM +0.6%) will offer an embedded version of the personalized radio service on its 2012 Camry and 2012 Tacoma models. The Camry is the top-selling car in the U.S., and the move fires a shot across the bow of Sirius XM (SIRI +4.4%) in the competition for in-vehicle listeners.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:17 PM
  • JCP

    Shares of J.C. Penney (JCP +3.1%) gain, even after the firm steers EPS guidance lower for Q3 and...

    Shares of J.C. Penney (JCP +3.1%) gain, even after the firm steers EPS guidance lower for Q3 and starts off the day in a 3% downward swoon in premarket action. The force of gravity from a "resilient" retail sector may be influencing JCP.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:05 PM
  • LVLT

    Level 3 Communications (LVLT +5.3%) is up after an FBR analyst says the company could...

    Level 3 Communications (LVLT +5.3%) is up after an FBR analyst says the company could justifiably offer $7.30 per share for Paetec (PAET +2.6%) in an acquisition that could create $250M in annual synergies.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:01 PM | 2 Comments
  • EIX

    Edison International (EIX +2.8%) rises after Citi upgrades the California utility and power...

    Edison International (EIX +2.8%) rises after Citi upgrades the California utility and power producer to Buy, and lifts its PT to $45. Citi's change of heart stems from assigning a higher target multiple to regulated utilities, and being less worried about California's regulatory climate.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:55 PM
  • TRMD-OLD

    TORM (TRMD-OLD +4.8%) trades up after it says Menfield Navigation's largest shareholder...

    TORM (TRMD-OLD +4.8%) trades up after it says Menfield Navigation's largest shareholder transferred her entire equity interest as a gift to the Alpha Trust, effectively giving the trust a 52% controlling interest in the shipper.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:52 PM | 1 Comment
  • OCZ

    OCZ Technology (OCZ +13.7%) is soaring on the back of its FQ2 revenue beat and guidance hike....

    OCZ Technology (OCZ +13.7%) is soaring on the back of its FQ2 revenue beat and guidance hike. The results might also be lifting other names with strong enterprise storage exposure. STEC +2.4%. STX +4.6%. QTM-OLD +3.6%. EMC +2.5%. NTAP +2%. BRCD +3.2%. (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:45 PM
  • T

    Leap Wireless (LEAP -1.8%) shares sink after Credit Suisse maintains a Neutral rating but cuts...

    Leap Wireless (LEAP -1.8%) shares sink after Credit Suisse maintains a Neutral rating but cuts its price target to $4 from $10. "LEAP does not have the scale and capital structure to support rising capex requirements," the firm says. Investors are underestimating those requirements and overlooking the impact of higher capex on the company’s equity value.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:36 PM
  • RELL

    Electronic component maker Richardson Electronics (RELL -5.1%) sells off after reporting FQ1...

    Electronic component maker Richardson Electronics (RELL -5.1%) sells off after reporting FQ1 results. While revenue of $41.5M (+11% Y/Y) met Street forecasts, EPS (from continuing operations) of $0.06 missed by $0.03. The company's FQ2 and FY12 revenue guidance ranges are in-line with consensus.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:33 PM
  • IOC

    InterOil (IOC +7%) pops after MKM ups the shares to buy on valuation. The company says the stock...

    InterOil (IOC +7%) pops after MKM ups the shares to buy on valuation. The company says the stock is down over 14% this month, and recommends adding exposure due to its "attractive risk/reward scenario."
     
     
     
     
    | 2:24 PM
  • TNK

    Some other casualties of Dahlman Rose's earlier downgrade on oil tankers due to a potential OPEC...

    Some other casualties of Dahlman Rose's earlier downgrade on oil tankers due to a potential OPEC petroleum cut: Teekay Tankers (TNK -4.3%) downgraded to hold, Frontline (FRO -3.4%) reduced to sell.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:09 PM | 1 Comment
  • OVTI

    After rallying strongly on the day the iPhone 4S was announced, OmniVision (OVTI -7.3%) is down...

    After rallying strongly on the day the iPhone 4S was announced, OmniVision (OVTI -7.3%) is down hard today on renewed fears of a loss of market share in the 4S to SNE. But ardent bull Paul Coster (I, II) is defending OmniVision again, claiming Apple's (NASDAQ:AAPL) description of the 4S' image sensor suggests an OmniVision design win.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:01 PM
  • ASGN

    On Assignment (ASGN -5.4%) trades lower after taking on a downgrade from Zacks to Neutral from...

    On Assignment (ASGN -5.4%) trades lower after taking on a downgrade from Zacks to Neutral from Outperform. The down day serves as a stark contrast to peers in the staffing sector - gaining strength as the industry lobbies Congress on a healthcare law effecting part-time workers.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:00 PM
  • ATI

    Shares of Allegheny Technologies (ATI +6.4%) power higher as the company extends its long-term...

    Shares of Allegheny Technologies (ATI +6.4%) power higher as the company extends its long-term titanium products supply agreement with Boeing (BA +2.3%) through 2018. The extension covers value-added titanium mill products and provides opportunity for greater use of ATI's highly engineered titanium cast and forged products. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:57 PM
  • ZAGG

    Shares of Zagg (ZAGG +8.1%) move higher after the firm looks to line itself up as a major...

    Shares of Zagg (ZAGG +8.1%) move higher after the firm looks to line itself up as a major outfitter for the iPhone 4S with a new protective shield available to consumers at retail stores and online.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:50 PM
  • BA

    Boeing (BA +2.1%) trades higher after announcing it delivered 127 commercial planes in Q3, up...

    Boeing (BA +2.1%) trades higher after announcing it delivered 127 commercial planes in Q3, up from 124 a year ago. 100 of the deliveries involved 737 jets, while one of them was the shipment of Boeing's first 787 Dreamliner. Boeing also delivered 20 military planes, 6 helicopters, 2 early warning systems, and 1 satellite.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:45 PM
  • GLGLF

    Shares of GLG Life Tech (GLGL -41%) - manufacturer of zero-calorie, natural sweetener stevia -...

    Shares of GLG Life Tech (GLGL -41%) - manufacturer of zero-calorie, natural sweetener stevia - plummet after saying it will miss Q3 guidance. The company says the Chinese beverage industry has been "materially" weaker than expected, resulting in lower-than-expected Q3 sales, and it's been forced to delay certain product launches by an average of two months, further hurting FY11 revenue.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:44 PM
  • SOL

    For the third straight day, solar stocks are off to the races (I, II). Given depressed...

    For the third straight day, solar stocks are off to the races (I, II). Given depressed valuations and industry growth forecasts, bulls and bears are arguably wagering over whether companies will survive the current shakeout. For now, the bulls have the upper hand. SOL +18.3%. TSL +9.1%. FSLR +6.8%. STP +7.6%. JASO +7.7%. SPWRA +8%. CSIQ +8.8%.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:27 PM | 1 Comment
  • INCB

    Shares of Indiana Community Bancorp (NASDAQ:INCB) decline 13% after the company announces it...

    Shares of Indiana Community Bancorp (NASDAQ:INCB) decline 13% after the company announces it will take a $14.1M writeoff for loan losses in Q3.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:05 PM
  • ITT

    ITT is up +2.6% today after tapping its CFO Denise Ramos to become CEO, the company's latest...

    ITT is up +2.6% today after tapping its CFO Denise Ramos to become CEO, the company's latest personnel move after it decided to split into three publicly traded entities.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:01 PM
  • BUD

    The report on a merger between SABMiller (SBRMY) and Anheuser-Busch Inbev (BUD -0.5%) isn't...

    The report on a merger between SABMiller (SBRMY) and Anheuser-Busch Inbev (BUD -0.5%) isn't winning over analysts wary of the long-running dalliance between the two brewers. S&P's Carl Short says, "I am not over-excited. It has been rumored before and will be rumored in the future." Shares of SABMiller are still keeping the faith though, up 6.7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:48 PM
  • PLCM

    Polycom (PLCM +6.5%) gets a boost after Argus ups the shares to buy on valuation with a $28...

    Polycom (PLCM +6.5%) gets a boost after Argus ups the shares to buy on valuation with a $28 price target, noting the company's improving videos services fundmentals.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:44 PM
  • AHT

    Ashford Hospitality Trust (AHT +7.8%) trades higher after raising its Q3 guidance. The company...

    Ashford Hospitality Trust (AHT +7.8%) trades higher after raising its Q3 guidance. The company now expects to report a 5.9% increase in RevPAR for all Legacy hotels in continuing operations, plus an increase of approximately 5.5% in RevPAR for all hotels in continuing operations in its Highland Hospitality Portfolio.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:39 PM
  • AYI

    Acuity Brands (AYI +7.5%) gains after KeyBanc ups the stock to buy, citing improved LED lighting...

    Acuity Brands (AYI +7.5%) gains after KeyBanc ups the stock to buy, citing improved LED lighting trends, new technological advancements and the company's push into the retrofit market.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:34 PM
  • ECTYQ

    Electric vehicle supplier ECOtality (ECTY +9.5%) jumps after being awarded a 5-year, $26.4M...

    Electric vehicle supplier ECOtality (ECTY +9.5%) jumps after being awarded a 5-year, $26.4M contract by the Department of Energy to conduct vehicle evaluations for the agency's Advanced Vehicle Testing and Evaluation project.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:27 PM
  • NYT

    New York Times (NYT +10.7%) surges today on news Carlos Slim has bought another $5M worth of...

    New York Times (NYT +10.7%) surges today on news Carlos Slim has bought another $5M worth of shares in the company - it adds up to about a 7.5% increase in his stake.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:21 PM
  • NEPT

    Neptune Technologies (NEPT +9.5%) trades higher after filing a patent infringement suit against...

    Neptune Technologies (NEPT +9.5%) trades higher after filing a patent infringement suit against Aker Biomarine ASA, Schiff Nutritional International (WNI +0.4%) and a number of other firms. The suit alleges that the companies are violating it's recently issued omega-3 composition patent.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:19 PM | 2 Comments
  • MBND

    DIRECTV provider Multiband (MBND +13.1%) pops after saying its Q3 revenues will exceed...

    DIRECTV provider Multiband (MBND +13.1%) pops after saying its Q3 revenues will exceed previously announced guidance. The company attributes its top line boost to improved operating efficiencies due to an expansion of its platform plus increased leverage in its overall business model.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:03 PM
  • SNE

    Sony (SNE +0.9%) puts smartphones at the center of its consumer strategy with talks to buy out...

    Sony (SNE +0.9%) puts smartphones at the center of its consumer strategy with talks to buy out Ericsson (ERIC +7.1%) from the companies' joint venture, WSJ says - at an amount estimated at $1.3B-$1.7B. The 50-50 partnership, formed in 2001, is the sixth-largest mobile phone maker.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:54 AM
  • ILMN

    Illumina (ILMN -1.3%) trades lower after Citi downgrades the maker of DNA analysis chips to...

    Illumina (ILMN -1.3%) trades lower after Citi downgrades the maker of DNA analysis chips to Hold, and lowers its PT to $44 from $90. The downgrade offsets a 13G filing from Scottish investment manager Baillie Gifford, stating the firm boosted its stake in Illumina in Q3 to nearly 10.1%. (previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:48 AM
  • EA

    Shares of Electronic Arts (ERTS +4.9%) post a solid gain after Wedbush adds the company to its...

    Shares of Electronic Arts (ERTS +4.9%) post a solid gain after Wedbush adds the company to its Best Ideas List and reaffirms an Outperform rating. The bullish sentiment on ERTS doesn't end there, analysts with the firm expect an earnings season "triple play" out of the game producer.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:43 AM
  • FDML

    The relatively good week for the auto industry is filtering down and lifting shares of companies...

    The relatively good week for the auto industry is filtering down and lifting shares of companies that manufacture parts. Gainers: FDML +6.7%, MTOR +6.1%, AXL +3.5, TEN +2.6%, CVGI +7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:34 AM
  • SKS

    Luxury retailers get a lift from better retail sales numbers: Saks (SKS +3.7%), Tiffany (TIF...

    Luxury retailers get a lift from better retail sales numbers: Saks (SKS +3.7%), Tiffany (TIF +5.7%), Coach (COH +4.5%). One exception to the rule however, is Nordstrom (JWN -1.1%). After reporting a blowout sales number and initially opening higher, the stock has moved into negative territory after running into selling pressure at a key technical resistance level.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:28 AM
  • AA

    Alcoa (NYSE:AA) gains 4.5%, leading a bevy of aluminum producers higher on a slightly better...

    Alcoa (NYSE:AA) gains 4.5%, leading a bevy of aluminum producers higher on a slightly better outlook. The Motley Fool postulates prices may get some support with Goldman Sachs behind the scenes as a trader of the commodity. Gainers: CENX +2.7%, NOR +4%, AWC +3.7%.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:07 AM
  • KODK

    Eastman Kodak (EK +14.8%) is surging today, as hopes for a patent payoff outweigh fears of...

    Eastman Kodak (EK +14.8%) is surging today, as hopes for a patent payoff outweigh fears of bankruptcy. But Citi's Richard Gardner thinks this is a good time to sell, arguing Kodak is unlikely to achieve its goal of generating $250M-$300M in 2011 revenue from patent licensing, given delays in its lawsuits against AAPL and RIMM.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:02 AM
  • MLCO

    Casino stocks with revenue tied to Macau continue their jumpy ways, this time moving higher en...

    Casino stocks with revenue tied to Macau continue their jumpy ways, this time moving higher en masse on a report from the city's government that revenue in the gambling mecca surged 39% last month. Gainers: MPEL +11%, WYNN +6.7%, LVS +4.4%, MGM +4.7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:48 AM
  • TPCG

    Shares of TPC Group (NASDAQ:TPCG), down 3.7%, get tripped up after Oppenheimer slashes its price...

    Shares of TPC Group (NASDAQ:TPCG), down 3.7%, get tripped up after Oppenheimer slashes its price target to $33 from $49. Though analysts with the firm keep an Outperform rating in place, EPS estimates for FY11 and FY12 are moved lower due to short-term pricing pressures.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:37 AM
  • CELG

    Celgene (CELG -1.5%) is trading lower this morning after a European panel recommended changes to...

    Celgene (CELG -1.5%) is trading lower this morning after a European panel recommended changes to the product label for Revlimid in the EU. The Committee for Medicinal Products for Human Use is urging the company to provide more complete information on the risk of secondary cancers from using the drug in the wake of several new studies.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:34 AM
  • ISCA

    International Speedway (ISCA -4.7%) tails off after cutting its revenue outlook as it sees...

    International Speedway (ISCA -4.7%) tails off after cutting its revenue outlook as it sees racetrack attendance across the U.S. diminish. The company points to a Kansas casino acquisition as accretive to earnings next year, and adding $0.20 per share before debt service to its net income by 2013.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:26 AM
  • TGT

    Target (TGT +4.2%) and The Buckle (BKE +4.4%) pop after reporting better-than-expected sales...

    Target (TGT +4.2%) and The Buckle (BKE +4.4%) pop after reporting better-than-expected sales data. Target's 5.3% same-store sales growth for September is well above September 2010's 1.3% growth, while The Buckle's 10.3% same-store growth boosted overall revenue growth for the period to 13%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:25 AM
  • STZ

    Shares of Constellation Brands (NYSE:STZ) are up 7.3% on the heels of an earnings beat. The wine...

    Shares of Constellation Brands (NYSE:STZ) are up 7.3% on the heels of an earnings beat. The wine and spirits maker raised its EPS guidance range by $0.10 to $1.92-$2.02 on the strength of its reduction in payroll and a bounce back in premium wine sales.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:17 AM

  • Trading in shares of Dexia have been suspended with the stock off 16.75% in Brussels. It may be...

    Trading in shares of Dexia have been suspended with the stock off 16.75% in Brussels. It may be some good news coming out, because European shares are off to the races again.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:15 AM
  • WTSL

    Shares of Wet Seal (WTSLA) -13.4%) take a beating after the firm misses estimates badly for...

    Shares of Wet Seal (WTSLA) -13.4%) take a beating after the firm misses estimates badly for September same-store sales, -0.3% vs. 3.8%. The company's e-commerce sales were particularly sluggish - coming in 22% lower Y/Y.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:10 AM
  • OSGB

    Overseas Shipping (NYSE:OSG) drops 5.3% after Dahlman Rose cuts the tanker fleet operator to...

    Overseas Shipping (NYSE:OSG) drops 5.3% after Dahlman Rose cuts the tanker fleet operator to Sell. Dahlman sees an OPEC production cut on the way, an event that would hurt demand for OSG's services. The firm also expects overall tanker demand to remain weak through 2012.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:07 AM
  • MNK

    Questcor Pharmaceuticals (QCOR) gets a boost with an initiation from Think Equity at Buy. Shares...

    Questcor Pharmaceuticals (QCOR) gets a boost with an initiation from Think Equity at Buy. Shares are on a run, up 3.5% today and 21% higher over the last 5 trading sessions.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:58 AM | 1 Comment
  • SFLY

    Shares of Shutterfly (NASDAQ:SFLY) recover, up 2.3%, after Tuesday's mid-Apple (AAPL -0.6%)...

    Shares of Shutterfly (NASDAQ:SFLY) recover, up 2.3%, after Tuesday's mid-Apple (AAPL -0.6%) announcement panic attack over the iCard debut sent shares down. Comments from Jefferies are helping calm the waters (previous).

     
     
     
     
    | 9:53 AM
  • MAR

    Marriott (MAR +1.6%) COO Arne Sorenson tells CNBC the company is "seeing no signs of weakness in...

    Marriott (MAR +1.6%) COO Arne Sorenson tells CNBC the company is "seeing no signs of weakness in the U.S." As for the buyback program: The company may not be able to divine the future, "but we can look at the valuation the market is putting on our stock and we think it's remarkably cheap." (earnings)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:39 AM
  • CMTL

    Comtech (NASDAQ:CMTL) +7.8% premarket, a day after Reuters reported several government...

    Comtech (NASDAQ:CMTL) +7.8% premarket, a day after Reuters reported several government contractors had expressed interest in a possible acquisition of the communications equipment maker. CMTL reportedly is working with Goldman Sachs for strategic advice in response to pressure from hedge fund MMI Investments.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:29 AM
  • COST

    Morgan Stanley weighs in on Costco (NASDAQ:COST), issuing an Overweight rating and a $90 price...

    Morgan Stanley weighs in on Costco (NASDAQ:COST), issuing an Overweight rating and a $90 price target on shares. The firm homes in on Costco's 10% membership fee increase as a solid earnings driver. Shares are up 1% premarket after beating estimates for September same-store sales, 12% vs. 10.1%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:23 AM | 2 Comments
  • ESIC

    Shares of EasyLink (NASDAQ:ESIC) gain 9.6% premarket after the firm reports its Q4 revenue...

    Shares of EasyLink (NASDAQ:ESIC) gain 9.6% premarket after the firm reports its Q4 revenue surged 135% Y/Y. Sales of the firm's On Demand Messaging service - which includes document capture and management, cloud-based fax, production messaging, and e-mail services - more than tripled for the quarter.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:13 AM | 2 Comments

  • Action sports retailer Zumiez +14.4% premarket and continuing yesterday's AH surge after it...

    Action sports retailer Zumiez +14.4% premarket and continuing yesterday's AH surge after it boosted Q3 guidance and said September same-store store sales jumped a much better-than-anticipated 10.1%

     
     
     
     
    | 8:38 AM

  • Shares of American Airlines slip 4.9% premarket, falling steeper than other carriers. The...

    Shares of American Airlines slip 4.9% premarket, falling steeper than other carriers. The company says traffic increased 1.9% in September on a capacity increase of 0.3%. Spinoff candidate American Eagle was a positive contributer to the total after reporting its own traffic was up 9.2% for the month.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:26 AM

  • U.S. stock index futures have given back the bulk of their meaty gains as the ECB declines for...

    U.S. stock index futures have given back the bulk of their meaty gains as the ECB declines for the moment to add further stimulus. S&P 500 +0.1% after being more than 1% higher prior to the 7:45 decision.
